name: Kokum Sherbet
history: Kokum Sherbet is a traditional drink from the Western coast of India, particularly popular in the Konkan region. Made from the kokum fruit, it's known for its cooling properties and health benefits.
description: Kokum Sherbet is a refreshing and tangy beverage made from kokum fruit, known for its digestive and cooling properties. It's a sweet and sour drink, often flavored with spices and sweeteners.

instructions.title: Soak the Kokum
instructions.description: Soak the kokum in 1 cup of water for about 1 hour until it softens.

instructions.title: Prepare the Sherbet
instructions.description: In a saucepan, combine the soaked kokum along with its water, sugar, cumin powder, and black salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then simmer for 5 minutes.

instructions.title: Strain and Chill
instructions.description: Strain the mixture to remove the kokum pieces. Allow the sherbet to cool, then refrigerate until chilled.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Kokum Sherbet over ice, garnished with mint leaves.

tips: Adjust the amount of sugar based on your preference for sweetness.
You can add a pinch of cardamom powder for an additional flavor dimension.
variations: Kokum Mojito: Add soda and a splash of lime juice to the sherbet before serving.
Spicy Kokum Sherbet: Include a few slices of ginger while boiling for a spicy kick.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Keep in a covered container and stir well before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Not applicable, as Kokum Sherbet is served cold.
presentationTips: Serve in tall glasses with a colorful straw for a fun look.
Garnish with a sprig of mint or a slice of lemon for an extra touch of freshness.
